newsitem.title: FINLAND: Baltic Ice - Stable, no new restrictions due.
newsitem.headline: Baltic Ice - Stable, no new restrictions due.

text.p: No extra navigation restrictions in Finnish waters were planned with ice levels roughly stable, the Finnish Institute of Marine Research said in its twice-weekly report on Monday.

Four icebreakers remained on station near St Petersburg and Vyborg in the eastern Gulf of Finland, three in the northern end of the Gulf of Bothnia, three in the middle of the Gulf of Bothnia and one outside Parnu in the Gulf of Riga.
PORT TEMP ICE TYPE THICKNESS RESTRICTIONS
St Petersburg n/a Level/compact 30-40 Russian ice class 13,
Rauma n/a Fast 10-30 Ice classes I, II,
Oulu n/a Fast/compact/ 40-65 Ice class IA,
Kemi n/a Windrow/rafted/ 40-75 Ice class IA
Lulea n/a Level 25-40 Ice class IB,
Kokkola n/a Level/compact 20-40 Ice class IA,
Ornskoldsvik n/a Fast 10-15 Ice class II,

NOTES: New ice - forming, thin and still moving. Fast ice - not moving level flat ice. Level ice - thick flat ice. Consolidated/compact - compact close ice. Windrow ice - reshaped by wind, thickness varies sharply. Rafted - ridges forming, 10-20 cm thick. Ridged - ridged or hummocked ice. Open - floes with water at rate of 4-6:10
